Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2010 06:46PM - edited Jun 19, 2010 07:57PM by tracihogg Did the biopsy yesterday. Was on the table for about 75 minutes and very sore today.  They got it done though and glad it is over. I held it together until it was over and then when they laid me over, I cried.  Now I have to wait until Tuesday/Wednesday.  One thing I did find out is they said it is a Birad 4 and then an A.  I thought it was a B.   Also, the medicine hurt going in (to numb the breast) but the actual needle to pull the tissue didn't.  Someone told me (not sure this is true), but they said that was a good sign. Any thoughts? Also, anyone think this could be fibrocystic even though it was 2.5 cms and a birad 4, a?  Looking for some hope here. I am praying for something that can be taken care of.
Posts.Title: Devastated...Magnified Mammogram shows Microcalcifications tracihogg shelleydodt

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2010 10:38PM tracihogg wrote: I asked this earlier, but no one mentioned this which worries me.  The fact that they found a 2.5 cm area of birad 4 microcalcifications, is that a huge area?  It seems like people are talking about less than 1 cm area.  I am worried this indicates cancer and if it were to be worse than just 0 or 1.  :(
Posts.Title: Devastated...Magnified Mammogram shows Microcalcifications tracihogg shelleydodt

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2010 01:20PM tracihogg wrote: I got my test results back already!  I am thrilled. They were B9.  Thank you to all of you women that helped me through it!  God bless you! Traci
Posts.Title: Devastated...Magnified Mammogram shows Microcalcifications tracihogg shelleydodt

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2010 05:13AM tracihogg wrote: If it is cancer...do you think it is early?  What if it isn't?  Do people go on to live normal lives after Breast Cancer?  I want to see my children grow up.   If it is B9 what does that mean going forward?  Why would I have a cluster of microcalcifications that look suspicious?   Thank you for your stories.  I need to hear more because I need to relate and know I can see my children grow up.
Posts.Title: Devastated...Magnified Mammogram shows Microcalcifications tracihogg shelleydodt

Posts.Content: tracihogg wrote: I'm 40.  Two kids...ages 8 and 5.  Last week was my first mamogram (well, I had one in 2002, but it didn't show anything and I only did it because I had issues after breastfeeding.)   They called and said calcifications were found.  Went back to get "magnified Mammogram" a few days ago and they said it was a "4" and needed a Steriotactic biopsy.  Had lots of calcifications on both breasts.  But, right breast had a specific area of 2.5 cm cluster of them. I am very small chested (an A) and skinny - 103 lbs..  So, they said the biopsy tomorrow may not work.  I am not sure what to hope for.  On a scale of 1-5, I am a 4 and that is suspicious and right below cancer.  Again, what can I hope for since they already saw the images magnfied???  I didn't think milk of calcium would be a hope since they could have already seen that.  Also, they did say I have fibrocystic changes in some areas (so they were able to see that magnified) so I guess that is out for this area???  Again, it is 2.5 cm's which sounds huge - that is 1 inch!  Also, it is in the inner quadrant of my right breast. Facts:  I don't smoke or drink and breast fed my first for 6 months and my 2nd for almost a year and a half.  I am 40.   The doctor put me on Xanax as I am crying a lot.  I am scared for tomorrow for the biopsy - if it can't be done.   Please help.  Do I have any hope for a negative outcome of is this pretty cut and dry that I have cancer???  I feel like I have cancer. If it is cancer...how bad is it?  Is it curable??? I am devasted today and feel like I am going to die and not see my children grow up. Just last week, I was fine. :(  Thank you, Traci (tracihogg@roadrunner.com) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Devastated...Magnified Mammogram shows Microcalcifications tracihogg shelleydodt

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2010 07:01AM - edited Jun 18, 2010 07:08AM by tracihogg The radiologist said birads 4 and then mentioned a 2 after that.  Does anyone know what the 2 means after that?  Maybe I misunderstood him since I was in a daze after he started talking with me.  Also, does anyone get their microcalcifications out if they are a B9?  What does B9 stand for (I realize it is good, but not sure what the definition is.)  Can you die from stage 0 or state 1 breast cancer?  I am so scared.  Also, the Xanax only works here and there.  It is only .25 mg once a day.  Seems like I needed more.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Devastated...Magnified Mammogram shows Microcalcifications tracihogg shelleydodt

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2010 05:43PM tracihogg wrote: @ JennyB. My stomach fell when I read your entry.  This is as far as I know right now, not a tumor.  They said it was Microcalcifications that are in an area that span 2.5 cms.  I am hoping that this isn't cancer (and praying.)  Has anyone has microcalcificatios in the area of 2.5 cms that it was something other than cancer?  Like Fibrocystic?  Did you find this out AFTER a biopsy or before that is what not cancer?  I can barely stand for the phone to ring tomorrow to tell me my results.

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2010 06:24PM tracihogg wrote: So, basically, even if the result is fine, I will need surgery.  That is the way it sounds.  They already said it can't be fibrocystic changes or they would have seen that on the mangified mammogram.  What is left???  One person said possibly milk of calcium, but the other person said they would have seen that on the magnified mammo.  So, what am I hoping it is?  If it is B9 I will still need surgery because I cannot live with the fact of checking every 6 months to see if these microcalcifications have turned bad???  Do I have the choice of a lumpectomy or masectomy if these are B9 but could turn someday?  Do they always turn?
